meanings.definition: The quality or state of being secondary.
meanings.sent1: Her secondarinesses in the group project was evident when she let others take the lead.
meanings.sent2: In the play, the secondarinesses of the supporting characters added depth to the storyline.
meanings.sent3: Despite his secondarinesses in the race, he still managed to finish with a smile.
meanings.sent4: The secondarinesses of the moon in the night sky made the stars shine even brighter.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the importance of understanding the secondarinesses of the historical event.

meanings.definition: The condition of being of lesser importance or rank.
meanings.sent1: The secondarinesses of the side characters allowed the main character to shine.
meanings.sent2: During the meeting, the secondarinesses of his role became more apparent.
meanings.sent3: Despite the secondarinesses of the dessert, it stole the show with its unique flavor.
meanings.sent4: The secondarinesses of the small island in the vast ocean made it a peaceful retreat.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the secondarinesses of each task helped prioritize the to-do list.
